oracle.pg.text

Class OracleIndexManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.pg.text.OracleIndexManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RDBMSIndexManager

    public abstract class OracleIndexManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A single point for managing/accessing all vertex and edge indices of a specific OraclePropertyGraphBase object.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int EDGE_CLASS_ID
      An integer constant to denote that the index is associated to edges
      static int VERTEX_CLASS_ID
      An integer constant to denote that the index is associated to vertices

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OracleIndexManager(OraclePropertyGraphBase opg)
      Creates a new OracleIndexManager object, handling external indexes associated to the specified property graph.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearAndCloseIndices()
      Clear and close all manual and automatic indices defined for the underlying property graph.
      void clearIndices()
      Clears all the data of the existing indices (manual and automatic) created on top of the underlying property graph
      void close()
      Closes this index manager object.
      void closeIndices()
      Closes and commits all opened indices stored in cache.
      void commitIndices()
      Commits all open indices.

        public final <T extends OracleElementBase> boolean containsIndexedKey(java.lang.String key,
                                                                      java.lang.Class<T> indexClass)
        Verifies if the auto index contains the specified index key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to validate.
        indexClass - index class
        Returns:
        true if the auto index contains the specified index key, else return false.

      • createIndex

        public final <T extends OracleElementBase> OracleIndex<T> createIndex(java.lang.String indexName,
                                                                      java.lang.Class<T> indexClass,
                                                                      OraclePropertyGraphBase pg,
                                                                      Parameter... indexParameters)
        Generates an index with a particular name, for a particular class, and of a particular type.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index
        indexClass - the element class that this index is indexing (can be base class)
        indexParameters - a collection of parameters for the underlying index implementation
        Returns:
        the index created

      • existEdgeIndex

        public final boolean existEdgeIndex(java.lang.String indexName)
        Verifies if the index with the specified name already exists for this property graph as an edge manual index.
        Parameters:
        indexName - the name of the index.
        Returns:
        true if the index already exists, else return false.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the index already exists, else return false.

        Returns:

      • isEdgeAutoIndexerEnabled

        public final boolean isEdgeAutoIndexerEnabled()
        Verifies if the edge auto indexer is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if edge indexing is enabled, else return false.

      • isVertexAutoIndexerEnabled

        public final boolean isVertexAutoIndexerEnabled()
        Verifies if the vertex auto indexer is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if vertex indexing is enabled, else return false.

      • refreshAllIndicesCache

        public <T extends OracleElementBase> void refreshAllIndicesCache()
        Refresh the cache for all auto and manual indices

      • refreshAutoIndices

        public void refreshAutoIndices()
        Refreshes all automatic indices based to the most up-to-date state of the graph. Must call refreshIndicesCache before executing this operation, so all existing indices are updated.

      • refreshEdgeAutoIndexCache

        public void refreshEdgeAutoIndexCache()
        Refresh the cache for automatic index on edges

      • refreshEdgeIndicesCache

        public void refreshEdgeIndicesCache()
        Refresh the cache for manual indices on edges

      • refreshIndicesCache

        public void refreshIndicesCache()
        Refresh the index caches associated to this index manager

        public <T extends OracleElementBase> void refreshManualIndicesCache()
        Refresh the cache for manual indices on vertices

      • refreshVertexAutoIndexCache

        public void refreshVertexAutoIndexCache()
        Refresh the cache for automatic index on vertices

      • refreshVertexIndicesCache

        public void refreshVertexIndicesCache()
        Refresh the cache for manual indices on vertices

      • remove

        public final void remove(java.lang.Object element)
        Removes the specified element from all the indices handled by this OracleIndex Manager object.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to remove.

      • remove

        public final void remove(java.lang.Object element,
                         boolean forceRefresh)
        Removes the specified element from all the indices handled by this OracleIndex Manager object.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to remove.

      • removePropertyFromIndices

        public final void removePropertyFromIndices(java.lang.String key,
                                            java.lang.Object element)
        Removes the property associated to the specified element from all the indices handled by this OracleIndex Manager.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to remove
        element - the element where the K/V pair will be removed

      • startAutoIndexingProperties

        public final <T extends OracleElementBase> void startAutoIndexingProperties(java.lang.String[] propertyNames,
                                                                            java.lang.Class<T> elementClass)
        Adds the specified property names to the properties used for auto indexing.
        Parameters:
        propertyNames - the property names which will be used to generate the index
        elementClass - the class of the auto index.

        Parameters:
        key - the key which will be used to generate the index
        elementClass - the class of the auto index.

      • stopAutoIndexingProperties

        public final <T extends OracleElementBase> void stopAutoIndexingProperties(java.lang.String[] propertyNames,
                                                                           java.lang.Class<T> elementClass)
        Removes the specified property names to the properties used for auto indexing.
        Parameters:
        propertyNames - an array of property names to be used to generate the index
        elementClass - the class of the auto index.

        Removes the specified key to the properties used for auto indexing.
        Parameters:

        elementClass - the class of the auto index.
